caption: Table 2: Meta-testing and clustering performance of few-shot sinusoidal regression.
description: This table shows the meta-testing performance (Mean Squared Error) and clustering performance (Silhouette, Davies-Bouldin index, Calinski-Harabasz index) of MAML and ConML-MAML on a few-shot sinusoidal regression task.  The results demonstrate that ConML-MAML improves both meta-testing accuracy and the quality of the learned models (as measured by clustering metrics).

caption: Table 2: Meta-testing and clustering performance of few-shot sinusoidal regression.
description: This table presents the meta-testing and clustering performance results for a few-shot sinusoidal regression task using two methods: MAML and ConML-MAML. The meta-testing performance is measured using Mean Squared Error (MSE) with 5-shot and 10-shot settings.  The clustering performance is evaluated using Silhouette score, Davies-Bouldin index (DBI), and Calinski-Harabasz index (CHI).  These metrics assess the quality of the clustering of model representations generated by each method, reflecting the alignment and discrimination capabilities of the respective meta-learners.

caption: Table 3: Meta-testing accuracy on miniImageNet.
description: This table presents the meta-testing accuracy results on the miniImageNet dataset for various meta-learning algorithms.  It compares the performance of the algorithms without ConML (the proposed contrastive meta-objective) and with ConML.  The table shows the accuracy for both 1-shot and 5-shot settings, and calculates the relative gain in accuracy and the relative increase in computation time introduced by ConML.  The algorithms are categorized by their approach (optimization, metric, and amortization based).

caption: Table 3: Meta-testing accuracy on miniImageNet.
description: This table presents the meta-testing accuracy results on the miniImageNet dataset for various meta-learning algorithms.  It compares the performance of each algorithm with and without the proposed ConML approach, indicating the relative gain and the relative time increase due to ConML.  The algorithms are categorized into optimization-based, metric-based, and amortization-based methods, and results are shown for both 1-shot and 5-shot settings.

caption: Table 1: Specifications of ConML.
description: This table summarizes the specifications of ConML for optimization-based, metric-based, and amortization-based meta-learning algorithms.  It lists example algorithms for each category and shows how ConML adapts to each category's different model representation (g(D; θ)) and optimization process.

caption: Table 7: Few-shot molecular property prediction performance (∆AUPRC) on FS-Mol. † indicates result from [36]. * indicates new approach proposed in this paper.
description: This table presents the results of few-shot molecular property prediction experiments using different meta-learning methods.  The ∆AUPRC (change in area under the precision-recall curve) metric is used to evaluate performance, comparing against a random classifier. The results show that ConML-Hypro, a new method proposed in the paper, outperforms existing state-of-the-art (SOTA) approaches across various shot settings (2-shot, 4-shot, 8-shot, and 16-shot).
